name: Empires Mod
description: Unique strategy/first person shooter mix: One commander on each team plays from above, choosing research, placing buildings and giving orders. The rest fill the role of soldiers on the ground, with four distinct classes to choose from and customizable vehicles to drive.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: 3.0 GHz P4, Dual Core 2.0 (or higher) or AMD64X2 (or higher) Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 128 MB or more with support for Pixel Shader 2.0b DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 8 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible

I remember playing this alot when I was younger. IT was fun, especially back then. I still want to play it, but it appears to me that people are leaving this game for 'dead.' Yeah, alot of the servers are virtually no-existant, and it's difficult, but that's only because people let it die! Honestly the creators might be busy with something else. This is a Source mod after all. Hell, I'm suprised this mod's still standing after all these years.   I suggest it because it blends RTS with FPS, which makes it way more interesting, mainly because the players are humans and not some drone who will blindly follow orders at the click of a mouse. Yeah, it's frustrating when you have difficulty in ordering people around, but there's always room for improvement. Even IF this game dies, I just hope some coder figures out how to add bots into the game.

This game is exceptionally good, especially in the complex and rewarding tactics possible. It's not some shoot-em-up where everyone only works for kills, early in the game most of the team is doing support roles.  An engineer can bring a skill to bring allies back from the dead, but still has his submachine gun, seismic grenades to destroy buildings, can construct buildings placed by the commander, placing his own turret, and a radar or camera, and dropping an ammo box. All of these can be done by a single player.  Meanwhile, a grenadier carries a mortar against buildings, a rocket launcher against vehicles, landmines, a handgun, the ability to detect mines, and can choose skills such as detecting the armor of enemy tanks, defusing mines, extra armor while driving, and many more.

The game looks rough around the edges, but it is a free to play game. But where aesthetics are not to par with other first person shooters, it makes up in playability and quality of game play. Everyone starts off equal in ability and rank, but the game rewards your performance. The more you play, the better you become, and thus you will be a better mmber of your team. Play the tutorial and do not be afraid to ask for help. Veteran players will go out of their way to help you maximize your experience in this game.

I had a nice little experience with Empires a while ago, back when it was a mod. Some of my best memories of gaming came from this here little mod, and the chant of people in the chat calling for rax's or refs still makes me want to pick this back up again.  Unfortunately, nobody else did.  I was a member, back in the old Empires back when it wasn't on Steam of | RAGE |. We won a game or two against the other then-main clan, Epic.   It's a shame, really, Empires was a good game. It had potential. I still want to play it, but unfortunately it seems that nobody else does.  Rest in peace.

This is probably my favorite HL2 mod although I have not played it for years. Everyone is fps except for a single commander who is rts style. You capture and hold resource points, research new techs, and then trash the other team's stuff and eventually their command vehicle which then wins you the game. If you have any source engine game on steam then this mod is FREE. Play it with me!

Honestly, this is one of the best tank battle simulators you will come across.  You must change which sides of your tank are facing the enemy to prolong your vehicles life.  A weaker tank can beat a higher class tank with good driving and tech but you are unlikely to beat a tier three with a tier one.  There is an economy and tech to worry about and while your comm can restrict spending on resources on tanks you can bypass his limitations by doing good and saving enough to buy your own.  Finally this simulates the military blunders by giving you a terrible commander or even giving you a team that pulls all arty tanks and getting floored by regular tanks that close in and kill them.  Oh, and you will want to be an engineer pretty much every time you play.

This game is NOT easy. But, who's to say thats a bad thing? Honestly, I'm a little sick of all the reviews that claim the game is so hard, yes the learning curve is a doozy, but it isnt impossible to master. Infact, I have 27 or so hours on my record at the time of writing this, and I've already gotten the hang of vehcile and infantry combat. The accuracy system can be very rewarding, and the damage system is unforgiving, yet satisfying. Yes, it's a very old HL2 Mod, but by god, It has potential. Think of it as a free, kinda rough planetside 2, give or take a few elements. I recommend it if you want to learn how to be a serous and good part of a team, and enjoy a hard, unforgiving yet rewarding FPS.
